definition: mouth/classifier for things with mouths (people, domestic animals, cannons, wells etc)/classifier for bites or mouthfuls
at or in the very same.../suitable/adequate/fitting/proper/to replace/to regard as/to think/to pawn/(coll.) to fail (a student)
to be/to act as/manage/withstand/when/during/ought/should/match equally/equal/same/obstruct/just at (a time or place)/on the spot/right/just at
lit. if you tap a half-empty bottle it makes a sound (idiom)/fig. empty vessels make the most noise/one who has a little knowledge likes to show off, but one who is truly knowledgeable is modest
pinyin: ban4 ping2 shui3 xiang3 ding1 dang1

definition: (coll.) tram, especially Beijing trams during period of operation 1924-1956/also written 鐺鐺車|铛铛车[dang1 dang1 che1]

sentences.english: It would be a terrific move for Portsmouth FC and a real coup.
sentences.chinese: 而這也會哐噹一聲，成爲朴茨茅斯的一次恐怖轉會。

sentences.english: The metal tool clanged when it hit the wall.
sentences.chinese: 金屬工具撞到牆上發出噹的一聲。
監獄的大門哐噹一聲關上了。

sentences.english: The bow twanged and the arrow shot away.
sentences.chinese: 弓噹的一響，箭就射出去了。
監獄的大門哐噹一聲關上了。

sentences.english: The door continued to bang all night .
sentences.chinese: 這門砰噹砰噹地響了一晚上。

sentences.english: The door continued to bang all night .
sentences.chinese: 這門砰噹砰噹地響了一晚上。

sentences.english: She clashed those pans down on the floor.
sentences.chinese: 她把那些盤子噹的一聲摔到地板上。

sentences.english: Then the liveried swordman 's thrown sword hit his chest with a loud clang and fell to the ground.
sentences.chinese: 跟着噹的一響，擲來的長劍刺中了他胸膛，長劍落地。

definition: child's buttocks (esp. Cantonese)/(onom.) crack, slap, clap, clatter etc
(onom.) scraping sound/ripping of fabric/screeching of tires
sound of an explosion/sound of sth throbbing or bursting
denote a sound or sharp noise (gunfire etc)
